title: Lemon Meatballs
introduction: Experience the bright and zesty flavors of lemon-infused meatballs, a delightful dish inspired by the sunny island of Capri. These meatballs, enriched with a hint of Parmigiano-Reggiano and aromatic pine nuts, are perfect for any gathering. Enjoy them on their own or with a light, fresh tomato sauce for an extra layer of taste.
ingredients: 1/2 cup dry crustless bread, cut into bite-size pieces
2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Soak the bread in the water for 10 minutes. Squeeze out the excess liquid.
In a large bowl, mix together all the ingredients except the oil and lemon wedges. Knead the mixture with clean hands until it is thoroughly blended.
Rinse your hands in cool water. Form the meat mixture into 1-inch balls.
Heat the oil in a large skillet. Add just enough of the meatballs as will fit comfortably without crowding. Cook, turning the balls occasionally, until browned on all sides, about 8 minutes.
